content.html:
• Well reader, how do you follow Nagoya? The answer, apparently, is by buying more furniture.
  • I now use Kagi. Unlike many other products I use, it Just Works™ and honestly I love it. It has restored my faith in the web, and I find myself using web search again.
  • A year ago I was sitting in an empty apartment, wondering what I’d got myself into. Today I haven't yet decided where I’m at, but I do know that this will be a banger yearnotes post.
  • Major release this week, which was heaps of fun and in-part put my Japanese to the test because it is very customer facing. I think that part went well. The todo list I assembled is now complete.
  • Almost immediately after the release I found myself thinking about the weeks leading into the start of this project, and a tactical error I made. I don't have many regrets but I do wish I could go back and change things.
  • We visited the Taco factory and gave them a run for their money. Much garlic shrimp was consumed that night.
  • What began as a challenge for me to procure a turkey several months ago turned into a thanksgiving celebration and my highlight of the week. I procured exotic wines and consumed an embarrassing amount of cookies and steak. Doritos were applied to things that they should not be applied to. We watched the Macy’s parade and for a moment I forgot that I was the only non-American in the room. There was no turkey.
  • What are you thankful for?
